content.rendered:
Photo by Pineapple Supply Co. via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis there’s two handy new resources from Sridhar Katakam, a very special edition of OfficeHours.fm, and a new tutorial from Brian Gardner.

Showcase

We kick off this week with the showcase and the first entry is a nice little number by Ryan Rudolph for grimlaw.com

New custom #genesiswp #WordPress website built at @GetPhound! – https://t.co/uIgZOH9geE pic.twitter.com/8Czy8SFLBA

— Ryan Rudolph (@ryancrudolph) July 25, 2016

Cami MacNamara rocks out a new site on the Wellness Pro theme for sstra.org

A new site launched by Webcami using the new theme Wellness Pro from @studiopress #genesiswp https://t.co/v5VrX6kune pic.twitter.com/gAeY8q8zEh

— Cami MacNamara (@webcami) July 25, 2016

Peter Shilling with a new site for kona.com.au…

New #WordPress site out the door for https://t.co/8WKNWpnUtP today #genesiswp https://t.co/54rvDREago pic.twitter.com/yWnh9J2mCC

— Peter Shilling (@PShilling) July 28, 2016

…and another one for alignfinancial.com.au

And another! New #WordPress site launched for https://t.co/6i0BkST1Dp #genesiswp https://t.co/2XGoUHcy9K pic.twitter.com/OjEwDFQGem

— Peter Shilling (@PShilling) July 29, 2016

Mike Hemberger for collegespun.com

Just launched a really high-traffic site. On-going stuff still to do, but we’re live! https://t.co/aJSxwdMFyb #genesiswp #WordPress

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) July 28, 2016

Next up, via Themetry, a nice customisation of their Milan Pro theme on oromtelielet.hu

What an excellent customization of our Milan Pro theme! Love seeing creative customizations like this. https://t.co/iocTLa90mI #genesiswp

— Themetry (@ThemetryHQ) July 22, 2016

And, on the subject of customising themes, here’s another one based on appfinite’s Apsire Pro from Joel Runyon for impossible.org

Check out this Great looking site @joelrunyon built with the Aspire Pro Theme – https://t.co/SeW0gVtqcG#genesiswp #wordpress

— appfinite (@appfinite) July 22, 2016

Beautiful site from Nicola Tweed for summertownpictures.com

In case you missed it the new STP website went live this week https://t.co/W14DYeFsRf #genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/RuIFeuJvOn

— Nicola Tweed (@nicolatweed) July 29, 2016

…and finally, in the showcase this week, a little peek at Nicola’ forthcoming Genesis site (and it’s looking good).

Yay to making time to work on my own site… https://t.co/RcTzCcC1bl coming soon! #genesiswp #beaverbuilder #web pic.twitter.com/5sBHNjtyta

— Nicola Tweed (@nicolatweed) July 26, 2016

Podcasts

Great episode of OfficeHours.fm this week, regular host Carrie is the guest and Tom McFarlin asks the questions.

i'm going to be hanging out with @cdils on #officefm today (except *i'm* hosting and she's answering questions). https://t.co/FxGjmcx7OE

— Tom McFarlin (@tommcfarlin) July 28, 2016

Best of the rest

I’m a big fan of Bill Erickson’s original tutorial on this (and everything else he publishes, make sure you check out his blog if you haven’t already) so I was interested to see Sridhar’s extension of this, ‘How to Load Posts on Demand using AJAX in Genesis’.

How to Load Posts on Demand using AJAX in Genesis:https://t.co/6EQM4lcCLlhttps://t.co/4MNSJCs6Vp

Thanks to @BillErickson.#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) July 28, 2016

He also added a new page on his site sorting all his tutorials by child theme.

Added a page in my site to show tutorials grouped by Genesis child themes: https://t.co/V046mMrAD9

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) July 26, 2016

Plus, if you didn’t catch it already, Sridhar also launched a Genesis tutorial search engine this week, over at genesis.community

Smart thinking #genesiswp https://t.co/kAq7dBwmjB

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) July 26, 2016

Brian Gardner has a new tutorial on how to showcase a grid of photos on your homepage.

New tutorial from @bgardner: Showcase a Grid of Photos on Your Homepage — https://t.co/gvKgdR2mr2 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/vwU05IlADG

— StudioPress (@studiopress) July 27, 2016

Jackie D’Elia with a good read on how she’s improving her codebase to save herself time.

Latest Post: How improving my codebase is saving me valuable time. https://t.co/sNt0VHF8AI #WordPress #GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/ywtWxNH5KY

— Jackie D'Elia (@jdelia) July 24, 2016

Chinmoy Paul’s been busy with a whole host of tutorials, including add logo from customizer in the Genesis primary menu bar and more.

Add logo from customizer in #genesiswp primary menu bar #nav #menu https://t.co/Y6B5qbK6tJ

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) July 27, 2016

And the folks at Imagely publish the second part of their new Q&A series including their recommendations for photographer websites and why they use Genesis.

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, @imagely answer q’s on websites for photographers & why they recommend Genesis https://t.co/ChlCRPZGP6

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) July 26, 2016

Amanda J. Rush with some praise for StudioPress and the Genesis community in general for its commitment to accessibility.

Thank you .@StudioPress and #GenesisWP for your commitment to #a11y https://t.co/9AL3iyCzZl

— Amanda J. Rush (@cswordpress) July 28, 2016

And finally…

It’s not Genesis specific, but check out this great post from WP Site Care on Improving the WordPress User Experience

A lot of work has gone into our new post! Improving the WordPress User Experience https://t.co/jYHjiMBLhv pic.twitter.com/8RU37YykAO

— WP Site Care (@wpsitecare) July 28, 2016

—

That’s all for this week, have a great weekend.

PS If you haven’t already take a look at Know The Code by Tonya Mork. If you’re a Genesis developer (or aspiring developer) looking to level up you won’t regret it (and there’s a free trial too).

PPS Did you know that as well as the weekly updates, we also rock the Twitter? Follow us now at @GenesisWPguide and feel more enlightened immediately.

excerpt.rendered: Two handy new resources from Sridhar Katakam, a very special edition of OfficeHours.fm, and a new tutorial from Brian Gardner.
